intro: Urospatha sagittifolia var. spruceana, commonly known as the arrowleaf urospatha, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It features lanceolate to arrow-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive basal rosette structure. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Its botanical characteristics include fibrous roots and a preference for moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories.
